result.execSummary:
The defendant James A. Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James A. Porter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James A. Porter was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BOND APPLIED - fine/costs pd in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A. Porter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cash bond from 16CM1296 applied to fine and costs in 15CM1311 per court record. kmk/nr

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Rose. Clerk/H. Barnett. ADA Drees states the deft completed the jail diversion program. Court enters judgment on ct 1. Court imposes $10 fine plus costs, deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge, bond applied from file 16CM1296.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA Drees states that if the deft agrees to extend his hold open agreement for 6 months she will not move to revoke the HOA.  RH continued to 8/24/17 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
to revoke stipulated hold open agreement; filed by ADA M Drees.
Behavioral Diversion Program status report.
Fax transmittal sheet.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Laura Williams/Behavioral Health Jail Diversion Program Coordinator appeared.  For reasons set forth on the record, RH continued to 2/8/17 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
Status report from Laura Williams/Behavioral Health Jail Diversion Program Coordinator.
Fax transmittal sheet.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Laura Williams/Jail Diversion Program present; states the deft is doing well in the program.  RH continued to 12/15/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rose states the deft will be able to continue in the jail diversion program.  ADA Delgado agrees that deft can have one more change to complete the program.  RH continued to 11/3/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Rose the RH of 7/19/16 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, to be after deft's SEHR in another matter; reset to 7/25/16 at 4pm.
With Atty Rose the RH of 6/28/16 at 11am is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 7/19/16 at 1:15pm.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C. Rose.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  The deft is being revoked on a different case and has sentencing after revocation in Br. 2 on 6/28/16.  ADA Delgado is not moving to revoke the HOA at this time.  RH set for 6/28/16 @ 11:00.  Bond continued.
status report by Laura Williams, Behavioral Health Jail Diversion Program Coordinator
Fax transmittal sheet
With Atty Rose and by agreement of ADA Delgado the RH of 5/26/16 at 8:30am is rescheduled; as he has an appeal on a revocation decision and are awaiting a decision; reset to 6/15/16 at 10am.
from Meredith Leon/Behavioral Health Jail Diversion Coordinator.
Fax transmittal sheet.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court withholds entry of judgment and allows a hold open agreement to go forward.  RH 5/26/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rose states the deft has applied for the jail diversion program.  FPT continued to 2/11/16 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rose states the deft is being evaluated for the behavioral health court.  FPT continued to 1/21/16 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rose states the deft was preliminarily accepted in the behavioral health treatment court.  FPT continued to 12/10/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Rose the time of the FPT on 11/19/15 is changed from 8:15am to 9am.

217 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Daniel Tombasco.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney  Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clk  Janell Thwing.  Not Guilty plea.    Deft demands jury trial. Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Defendant is on a PO Hold.  $2500 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).
